Package project1

Class Kiosk

  • java.lang.Object
    • project1.Kiosk
  • public class Kiosk
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains a constructor that instantiates a Kiosk object consisting of a schedule that is continuously updated or printed to the console based on user commands. This class contains a method that take in commands from the user, and helper methods that format the input, check for input errors, and book/cancel appointments.
    Author:
    Darrel Dsouza, Anton Derkach

    • Method Detail

      • initializeTempAppt

        private void initializeTempAppt​(java.lang.String input)
        Creates a temporary appointment object to hold user input while checking for errors.
        Parameters:
        input - The string input by the user into the kiosk.

      • isValidInput

        private boolean isValidInput()
        Checks if appointment information input by the user is valid, if not, prints an error message to the console.
        Returns:
        True if input is valid (no errors)

      • copyPartialArray

        private java.lang.String[] copyPartialArray​(java.lang.String[] arr,
                                            int startIndex)
        Gets part of an array, from a certain start index to the end
        Parameters:
        arr - The array to get a part of.
        startIndex - The dividing point of the array, all values before this index are not returned.
        Returns:
        A new array containing elements from the input array from the start index to the end.

      • formatInput

        private void formatInput()
        Scans a string input from the console, and splits it into a command and a detail string.

      • C

        private void C()
        Cancels the input appointment if it exists.

      • CP

        private void CP()
        Cancels all appointments by the same patient as the input patient.

      • B

        private void B()
        Books an appointment that was input by the user.

      • run

        public void run()
        Runs the kiosk by continuously looking for commands in the console and executing them. Commands include "B" to book an appointment, "C" to cancel an appointment, "CP" to cancel all appointments of a given patient, "P" to print the schedule, "PZ" to print sorted by clinic zip code, and "PP" to print sorted by patient name and DOB.
